page.title: 12 The Windsor Lodge Hotel
page.content: The Windsor Lodge Hotel was built at the turn of the century by Wrights of Great Missenden. The present owner, Mr.Riley,has been at the Hotel for twenty four years. At first it was used as a school for backward, privileged children. The school had seventy mixed children and the cellar was used for the childrens bicycles, while their playroom was the present bar. It was a school until 1961 when it was changed into a hotel by Mr. Sherwood. The Hotel,which has a restaurant and is used as a conference centre,has twenty six bedrooms,half of which are single. Twenty years ago a single room cost Â£1.35 a night,it now costs Â£27.50. Each room has a small colour television and a radio. The hotels customers are attracted to it by its good reputation.
